Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:46 yo white f notary presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the back of the head (LOC 36 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 30 mph on impact. patient c/o moderate nausea, severe headache, mild vomiting and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 153 cm, Weight 49.9 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 17, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:46 yo female notary presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 36 min). she denies nausea, headache and vomiting since the accident. she has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). she has resumed usual state of function. she denies smoking she is a heavy drinker o:Height 153 cm, Weight 50 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 72, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.46, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
